inn1.comm: 132kph, what a whip! Stayed on his back foot and punched this shortish ball outside off stump through the gap between point and cover! Aggression early on from Pakistan!
not this time says Malinga as he goes fuller and targets top of middle. Sharjeel gets in line and blocks

another punch! Gee, his timing is breathtaking this afternoon and of course, early signs that this pitch is a belter. It was far more closer to off stump this time but Sharjeel was camped on the back foot and drills it in front of point again
good length ball on middle, Sharjeel pushes to the newly placed short cover
fullish on off stump, Sharjeel prefers to stay back and push to cover

the bowler has the last laugh! This was full and swinging in on middle and leg, Sharjeel has flicked it into the safe hands of mid-on! Two sumptuous strokes on the off side and he's thrown it away. If he was going to hit that straight, he should have kept it down or he should have nudged it through midwicket for a harmless single. But his own momentum has swallowed him.
he does. Just a hint of movement away as he pitches back of a length and outside off. Left alone
there's that shuffle back and across which helps him get in line with this shortish ball outside off and he blocks right under his eyes
slashed behind point! Shehzad is moving as well. It was uppish, but was dying on the point fielder. Chaturanga it was. Shortish and only the smallest room, but it was enough

magnificent strike! But he will have to settle for a single as Priyanjan pulls off an amazing save at cover. This was overpitched and had loads of room outside off. Shehzad wades into a drive and has timed it just about perfectly, but the fielder dives to his left and saves three runs
overcorrection from Lakmal and he was waiting for that. Nudged off his knees to fine leg. No bat involved
fullish on middle. pushed back to the bowler
lovely line from Malinga. This was on off stump with a bit of nibble away. Hafeez wasn't perfectly solid, but he keeps it out safely
hint of swing away off that slingy action. The line was outside off though so Hafeez doesn't bother with it
fullish on off stump, Hafeez is half-forward and blocks down the pitch
too straight and that's what Hafeez needed. Moved his feet just enough and made sure he concentrated on keeping his balance. Flicked between square leg and midwicket. Crisp shot
back of a length and outside off, Shehzad gets in line and blocks to short cover

another one, Malinga does it again! Punches the air and lets out a war cry that will ring throughout MIrpur. Shehzad saw a bit of width and was setting up for that back-foot punch in front of point. Struck a crisp boundary in the last over off that shot, but this time he only ends up nicking off. Touch of seam away does him in as he doesn't move his feet
back of a length on off stump, defended with very soft hands

dropped but that was tough to pull off. It was short and wide, but this one bounces a bit more off the deck. Hafeez thought this was an easy boundary and went for a cut. Goes uppishly and to the left of point where Sena dives full length and is off the ground when he connects with both hands
shortish and just outside off, goes back and blocks
terrific delivery! This time he drags the batsman forward with one of those outswingers and Hafeez was very tentative. Wafts at it and his balance was nowhere near proper
fullish and outside off, left alone wisely as this moves away as well
fullish and outside off, Hafeez lunges forward and lets it go
fullish on off stump, Misbah works to midwicket and calls "one"
bit more bounce there again as Hafeez has to check his shot. Went forward at the good length pall with a push, but then softens his hands to smother it

Malinga is taking this final by the scruff of it's neck! Another catch to Sanga and Pakistan are three down in the fifth over! Good length ball, with a bit of movement away and it proves enough to snare a regulation outside edge. Hafeez has hung his bat out there with no feet and perishes. Squared him up.
fullish on middle and leg, he nudges forward and blocks
fullish on middle and leg, Fawad pushes to mid-on and there is a loud call of "no." Guess they remember Misbah's run-outs from the previous games
full on leg stump, it was the slower ball. Fawad was a little too soon to close the face of his bat and gets a leading edge to cover. Malinga presents a million-dollar smile, and who can stop him?
back of a length and outside off, stands up tall and blocks into the off side
full and angled in, Misbah plays that as he leans forward and turns in front of square leg

this time Lakmal ducks it back in! That was a very brave leave! I daresay Misbah did not pick that! Good length ball outside off, but once it pitched it swerved to attack off stump. Missed it by a whisker and Lakmal has his hands on his head
fullish and nibbles away this time, that's his stock delivery. Misbah is forward and nudges into the covers
good length ball pushed across him, Alam whips his bat out of the way
shortish and angled across him, Alam bends his knees and evades it

134 kph, always at the stumps and this time Misbah tries to move across to off stump and flick to fine leg. This was full and straight and it kissed the pads through to the keeper. Mild appeal, but I guess that would have gone down
curves in as Malinga is full on middle. Misbah makes sure he doesn't have to play around his front foot and works to midwicket
yorker on middle and Alam digs it out with a little turn to midwicket. He's sticking steadfast to that Chanders-like stance
fullish on of stump and that seemed to keep low judging by the batsman's reaction. Crouches down as he defends
fullish on off stump, Alam defends from his crease
115 kph, change of pace but it's been picked. Fullish delivery on off stump. Alam is on his back foot and keeps it out
back of a length and just outside off, Misbah pushes into the covers
good length ball on middle, Misbah's straight bat comes down in answer
good length ball outside off, dabbed towards point

138kph, jumps up off a good length and strikes Misbah on the glove! Lovely line from Lakmal as he's making an excellent case for himself in the final. The batsman was lunging forward and had to adjust quickly to make sure the ball goes down
137 kph, good pace too. Length ball outside off, strides out to defend
full and drifting in, Misbah works it down to midwicket
tossed up just outside off, Alam prefers to stay back and slice to point
flighted on middle and leg, Alam defends

flighted just outside off and he's punched it through cover. That was all timing. Opened the face at the last minute to evade Mathews on his right and despite a dive at the boundary, this ball just skimmed away
flighted on middle and leg, nudged into the on side
tossed up and angled in on middle, Alam protects his stumps and blocks
tossed up on off middle and leg, kept out. He's definitely a different bowler when he flights it
good length ball on off stump brings Misbah forward in defence
walks at him and this becomes a shorter ball on off stump, Misbah blocks into the covers
sliding down the pads this time and this is tickled around the corner. Neat stroke from Misbah. Long leg rushes across to keep it to two. Vithanage was the man, subbing for Malinga
fullish and just outside off, eased towards midwicket with soft hands and Misbah completes the single with yards to spare.
back of a length and probing outside off, Alam chases it and dabs towards point
full on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on and since he's not timed it at all they race through for another quick single. Excellent ploy
good length ball on leg stump, doesn't turn and he nudges to midwicket
too short there and Alam has pounced. It was just outside off stump, but he's made a world of room for himself and slams it in front of point
flighted on off stump brings Alam forward with a block
tossed up on leg stump and he pushes to mid-on
short again and Alam's smacked it to the sweeper that's been placed

flighted just outside off and Misbah's essayed a charming extra cover punch. Came nicely forward to reach the pitch so that striking against the turn isn't as big a danger. Lovely straight bat came down on that
back of a length and just outside off, defended
moves away to punch this shortish ball outside off to short cover
136kph, back of a length and outside off again. Alam was playing a little away from the body as he opens the face to find cover
shuffles across to punch this back of a good length delivery towards short cover
fullish and pushed across him, Alam is forward and steers just behind point. Sena dives and keeps it to none
full and just outside off and Alam sets off after driving to mid-off. The fielder was quick to the ball and the call of no arrives just soon enough to allow Misbah to get back
fullish on off stump, Misbah walks at him and blocks
keeps it right up there and outside off, Misbah strides out and blocks into the covers
fullish and outside off, Misbah's defence is good enough

good length ball just outside off as he strides forward to block. he's played it with such soft hands that the ball squirms around back towards the stumps, but Misbah's wise to it's progress and stops it
walks at him again as Mathews pulls his length back. Dabbed towards point. More dot balls
fullish and outside off, pushed into the covers and its another maiden
fuller and rather wide outside off, enough for Alam to slash but gets a thick outside edge to deep third man
back of a length and just outside off, finds mid-off with a little push
fuller and just ducks back in off the pitch. Misbah was looking to drive on the up and gets an inside edge onto pad
comes forward and across to set him up to the fuller delivery on off stump and drives to cover
136kph, skips down the track but as this is slid outside off stump, Misbah refrains from playing
fullish and outside off, steered to point and that's just one of the last three overs
fullish and angled across him, Alam stays leg side of it and works towards point
fullish and just a shade outside off, Alam is forward with a block
clipped off his pads towards deep square leg. Mathews strays too straight and allows a release of the pressure
fullish and outside off, steered to point
Alam wants the single, but is sent back. This was full and just outside off. Pushed down the ground and though it was the batsman's call, Misbah says no
good length ball, pushed into the covers
138kph, walks at him as this is a good length ball just outside off. Blocked
shortish delivery has enough room for Misbah to run this behind point
walks across his stumps to try and pick up some easy runs down the leg side, but this good length ball strikes him on the pads. Mild appeal, this would have slid down leg
punched into the off side and short cover runs to his left to get a hand to it. That caused enough confusion to prevent the batsman from taking a single as the ball runs down to mid-off
flicked away to deep midwicket. Too straight with the length ball
fullish on middle and off, worked just wide of mid-on
bit of width outside off and Misbah exploits it by dabbing to third man. Good use of the open face
walks at him, but can only push the fuller delivery angled across him towards short cover.
fullish on off stump, strides forward to defend
back of a length and just outside off, Alam was looking to whip through the leg side and gets a thick inside edge. Bit more bounce there for Mathews
full on leg stump, leans forward and completes an easy flick to deep midwicket
back of a length and outside off, left alone
fullish and outside off, nudged to short cover. Look out for that word if Alam keeps batting
full and just outside off, Alam is forward and pushes down the ground. Used a closed face to make sure it was fine of mid-off, who has to run to his left and dive. A parry to mid-on keeps it to one
full on off stump but Misbah moved across outside off and clipped towards midwicket. Quick single, well taken

short and wide outside off, Alam is set up to slap through point. Too wide to connect, says umpire Llong who has not seen the bottom edge that falls short of the keeper. Shrugs his shoulders at Sanga who tells him there was a nick
fullish and angled across him, pushed to mid-on
too full and too straight clipped to deep midwicket. I'm counting one of those every over in the past three. First signs?
walks across and sets up on off stump, picked away to deep square leg for a couple. That was lovely placement from the Pakistan captain
back of a length on middle, Alam was across on middle and off and works in front of midwicket. Wants the single and his captain responds. No trouble in the end as Priyanjan fails to pick the ball up
well bowled there. it was a touch slower on off stump but he kept it full. Misbah could only come forward and block
fullish on off stump, driven down the ground and Misbah says "run, run, run, run, run". Alam heard it loud and clear
fullish and pushed across him, eased into the covers off the front foot
short and wide, Alam wants to smack that through point but he had to reach out for this too much. Goes right off the bottom of the bat
fullish on off stump and Alam can only push back to the bowler
good length ball just outside off, Misbah guides towards point with an open face
point's in business again as this is a good length ball outside off
back of a length on middle and leg, flicked to long leg for an easy single. That's the kind Misbah loves
shortish again as Alam waits on the back foot and punches through to the sweeper. Played nice and close to the body there
134kph, Misbah's lured into a false shot! It was not quite short nor was there too much room on offer, especially with him shuffling across. Cuts underneath the ball as it goes through to the keeper
lets this length ball strikes the bat and opens the face on impact to pick up a single to third man
fullish on off stump, defended down the pitch
fullish and just outside off and Misbah is forward with a push which cannot beat the bowler's left hand

loud, concerted pleading appeal from Sri Lanka. Misbah smiles and looks skyward and umpire Oxenford says calm down boys. It was the cross-seamed delivery just outside off. Lured Misbah into a guide to third man. And hello, hello, there was a fine edge there as it went to the keeper. Mathews knew it, Sanga was wildly positive and Misbah was already relieved
length ball with a bit of room, this time the steer to third man works
comes forward and nudges this fuller delivery down towards midwicket
125 kph, good length ball which straightens a touch. Misbah is solidly behind it and as it goes down to the bowler, Mathews kicks it. Can't say I blame him
good length ball on middle, whipped away to long leg
full and just outside off, punched towards mid-off and they scamper through for a single
bit of room outside off as Alam shuffles across and finds short cover
full and angled across him, Alam leans into a drive but checks it. Closed the face which means the ball goes down to mid-off
room outside off again, I'm getting the feeling this is a ploy. Alam his half-forward and slices to the sweeper
there's the bang after the tuk tuk tuk! Length ball from Perera and he has walked into it and swung over deep midwicket. Big followthrough, big heave, big six
back to back boundaries brings up the fifty partnership. This was back of a length and just outside off, Alam punches down the ground with a closed face to make sure he beats mid-off
sorry-looking drive outside off as Mathews beats him with the change of pace. Visibly disappointed at not claiming the outside edge
fullish and aims at the stumps, Alam drives straight down the ground and picks up a quick single
good length ball on off stump, defended calmly

fullish and it straightens at the last minute. Misbah is good enough to ride it and sneak a sharp single into the covers. I get the feeling with Misbah the hiking of the run rate is more off a feeling than a plan.
fullish and  just outside off, blocked back to the bowler
flighted on off stump, picked away to midwicket
good length ball on the pads, works it fine for a quick single into the leg side
shortish and just outside off, Alam goes back and pushes into the covers
top-edge balloons over the keeper. This was nicely flighted outside off but Alam wanted to go for the lap sweep. Survives and sneaks a couple
on a length as he goes back and cuts behind point. Misbah agrees to the single
worked away to the right of midwicket and the placement is so good that he picks up two. Right in between the men inside and outside the circle
tossed up on middle and off, nudged back to the bowler
more flight just outside off as Alam strides forward to work straight of midwicket
flighted on off stump, Misbah sets up for the reverse sweep but doesn't connect properly
flighted on off, pushed towards mid-off but the bowler prefers to do his own fielding
this time there's more oomph into the drive and he finds long-off
flighted around the off stump, lunges forward to defend to midwicket
little nudge to the right of midwicket results in a single. He's playing this line very well. Time for the one that doesn't turn, Sena
flighted on middle and leg, Alam works into the leg side for a single. Late response from Misbah, but it's safe enough
whipped away to deep square leg as this is tossed up on middle and leg
flighted on and around off stump, blocked to midwicket
holds his length back just a touch as Alam finds midwicket with a soft nudge
speared in on middle and off with more of a round-armed action, Misbah keeps it out
worked to long-on as this is full and pushed through on middle and leg
flighted outside off, drives off the open face to the sweeper on the off side
flighted outside off, Misbah drives uppishly but it goes wide of the the bowler who was diving to his left.
slower and flighted on middle and leg, Alam pushes back to the bowler
pushed through outside off and Alam uses that pace to steer behind point. Rapid single nicely done
flighted on middle and leg, Alam strides forward and works towards the vacant square leg region. Steady supply of singles now
this is a lot slower and it doesn't turn either. Misbah is wary of it though as he shuffles across and blocks
nudged to midwicket as he moves across to off stump to negotiate this flighted delivery on middle
another one that's slowed down, but this one is down leg. Misbah ticks it away to short fine
good length ball on middle, Misbah lets it come to him and works it towards square leg which is vacant for the right-hander too
flighted on middle and leg, pushed back
flighted on middle and off, kept out
fired in on middle and leg, flicked away with ease
flighted on off stump as he moves across it to sweep. Big appeal from Sanga. In fact his scream was deafening, but the ump's unmoved, spotted the inside edge
shortish and outside off, slapped to the sweeper
flighted and pushed across him, driven to deep point again
employs the same technique, but this time de Silva slides a quicker length ball on middle which Misbah flicks down the ground
goes on the sweep a little too early, which allows Sena to shorten his length. But Misbah waits just that little bit more and goes through with the shot.
rocks back to this length ball and punches to mid-on. Wanted to whip it a little squarer to find the gap
targets the channel outside off and Alam was making a little room for himself to cut. Finds point though
flighted on off stump, he strides forward to block
slower ball, tossed up on middle and leg. Alam flicks uppishly past a short midwicket.
turned away towards square leg and this is going to be a very sharp single but Misbah makes it in the end. If it had been a direct hit though...

swept and he finds the boundary to bring up Pakistan's hundred. Terrible line from the bowler as this was full and flat and well down leg. Misbah plants his front leg outside off and beats the short fine leg fielder

another sweep, but this was a length ball and it was a little quicker too. Cramps Misbah while he was on his knees. Dabbed towards midwicket and had taken a couple of steps forward. Alam answered and he has to rush back to save himself as the captain changes his mind
flighted outside off and he jams his bat down and slides it towards point
tossed up on leg stump, worked away in front of square leg
and there it is, another fifty for Misbah off a strong sweep, this time to the left of short fine leg. Those darts on the pads are not working, Chaturanga

flighted and just outside off, Misbah lunges forward and pushes into the covers. Alam had set off again, but has to rush back. A little bit of excess energy in the busy left-hander. Hope he's spent it all now

top-edge but it lands short of the long leg fielder! Why did he pull out of it so soon? This was in the air long enough and he could have made the effort to cover the extra ground and go for the catch. This partnership is blossoming too easily
flighted on the pads, worked off it
flighted on the pads, strides forward and blocks down the pitch
another lap sweep, looks like he will not put it away. Top edge to long leg, but this fell well short. Sena's did  well there as he speared it full and outside off
slows it down and pulls the length back too, Misbah who is not looking to play innovative shots, just calmly works it through square leg
just a touch short and he rocks back to cut to deep point
132kph, starts off with a wide one but it's just good enough to escape. Alam was looking to smear it through point, but can't connect
little waft outside off and this beats the outside edge as well. Played under this fuller delivery outside off
dropped by Sanga! It was another almighty heave from Alam as he chased down the track. Thick outside edge flies to the left of the keeper who leaps up and sticks out a glove. Very tough chance!
good length ball on the stumps, kept out
low full toss, tailing in on middle and leg. Misbah pushes down to long-on
backs away to punch this shortish ball just outside off to deep point
clears that front leg and slammed it over wide long-on! Presents one in the slot for the left-hander's arc and Alam takes full advantage with a solid heave for 70m
second consecutive fifty for Alam as he nods to the dug out and raises his bat to the crowd after a smattering of applause. This was a length ball outside off, carved through point
length ball on off stump, but Misbah's moved around in his crease and ensured he was outside the line of it before flicking behind square leg
short and wide outside off, Alam goes for the cut and doesn't hold back. Gets a thick edge to deep third man. I get the feeling he's tiring here, already faced 92 balls and a lot of that was singles
fullish on off stump, Misbah shuffles across again but is kept to a push down the pitch
back of a length and just outside off, waits for it and guides it in front of point with an open face. This time Pakistan might be a little more comfortable gong into drinks

very full and it hits Misbah on his toes without pitching! Loads of swing into him as well. Bit appeal from the bowler, but it would have gone down leg. Good call from umpire Oxenford even as Lakmal returns to the top of his mark, a little dejected
another inswinging yorker, at 137 kph, Misbah digs this out though. Kept his front foot out of the way
good length ball on and around off stump, defended to midwicket
138kph, another that tails in as the yorker ends up a low full toss. Misbah flicks but can't beat midwicket
he's strung four excellent deliveries in a row. Yorker that tails in on off stump and keeps Misbah to his stoic defence
bunted down the ground as he finishes with another full, inswinging delivery. Single as Lakmal keeps his economy below two today
good length ball on middle and leg, Misbah works it away to deep midwicket
flighted on leg stump, Alam makes loads of room outside leg and cuts to cover. Misbah wants the single but is sent back

mid-on was up in the circle and Alam has played a calculated shot over his head. Though this was against the turn, if there is any on offer, he plays with the angle and it was also a length ball. Top strike
quicker and flatter down the pads, Alam sweeps to short fine leg

and he's cleared them all! Towering six over deep midwicket earns applause from the crowd and Zaheer Abbas. Went down on one knee and muscled it away. Only the ball boy had a chance of taking it and so he does
shortens his length and works it away to deep square leg
low full toss, whipped towards midwicket. Excitable Alam was again down the pitch searching for a quick run. Not there
full on off stump, Misbah's thumped it down to long-on with very little feet. It was all in his arms and the whip to power it
shortish and bowled on the body, Alam nudges it off his hips

he's holed out at long-on and Malinga is at it again! It wasn't the prettiest ball, just full and outside off. Misbah heaves it straight over the top but has dragged this. That foils his timing and results in a simple catch to Kusal who extends his arms in delight. Somewhere in front of him, Misbah is immensely disappointed.
slower ball on leg stump, Alam works it away behind square leg
lovely yorker on off stump, just about the perfect ball to a new batsman. Aside from a searing inswinging yorker. Possibly why Akmal kept it out
shortish on middle and Alam's half-pulled it just wide of mid-on! It was that short-armed jab and the power in it was astonishing.
flighted on the pads, he works it wide of mid-on again.
flighted on middle, Akmal has dabbed it in front of square leg and with everyone on the boundary there this was easy two
whipped away to deep midwicket and fresh legs allow for another couple. Great hustling
flighted on off stump, strides forward and blocks
stays beside the flighted ball on off stump and drives towards extra cover
low full toss on middle, clipped to midwicket
slower ball on off stump. Alam dabs to point and had set off for one of his impulsive singles. Akmal is more level minded
full delivery, swinging a touch away outside off. Alam gets a thick outside edge to deep third man
fullish and sliding down leg, Akmal is forward and flicks to long leg
119kph, slower ball, tucks him up for room on middle and leg. Alam is still good enough to dab it into the off side and race down to the other end
fullish and on middle and leg, Akmal picks it away to long leg
back of a length and outside off, steered to deep third man and Akmal's urgency between the wickets is remarkable
thumped, but only as far as mid-off. Length ball from Lakmal. Dangerous ploy, especially considering all those lovely yorkers he bowled in his last over
there it is. In the blockhole on middle and Akmal whips straight of midwicket
yorker on off stump, Alam makes room and squirts this towards point with one hand off the bat
leg-stump yorker keeps Akmal tied to the crease. This is excellent bowling.
shortish on off stump, Akmal works it off his hips for a single
short and wide, Akmal flays this into the covers but Thirimanne dives to his right and parries it towards the bowler. Wrings his hand, that was hammered

terrific strike! He had raced down the track and though it was the slower ball intended to deceive him, Akmal goes through with a loft over mid-off. Made enough room to enable the stroke, which had little risk with all the deep fielders on the leg side

another leg cutter and this time he cuts and beats point! Akmal was moving outside leg and the bowler panicked. Offers perhaps the worst ball in that situation, short and outside off. Cut away to great effect
goes fuller but this slips too far outside off.
full and outside off, Akmal goes forward and drills it into the covers. Why is he bowling it wide and outside off when he has three men deep on the leg side?
wide yorker and he guides it behind point for a quick single. Direct hit at the other end, but Akmal was well home
slower short ball on middle, Alam was surprised and has to halt his pull midway through the shot. Gets a thick inside edge to long leg
fullish and angled across him, Alam was looking to smash it straight down the ground but all for nought
heaved away and it just about eclipses a leaping long-on! Alam set up deep in his crease and turned this fuller delivery into a length ball. Then strode forward and slammed it straight
another length ball slid across the left-hander. That's what Alam is looking for, to free his arms. But again, doesn't connect
slower ball, dragged down short and offers room outside off to boot. Alam pulls to the deep square leg boundary. This is such a handy innings from the new middle-order bat
very full with a bit of width, Alam opens the face and carves to deep third man
fuller delivery which slips down the leg side as Akmal looks to flick. Was the slower ball again. Sanga dives across but cannot collect cleanly
140kph, full with a bit of width and he stays deep in his crease and steers it to deep third man.
fullish on off stump, Alam stays back and taps it to deep cover
keeps it nice and full on off stump, Akmal stays low and nudges it into the extra cover region
big effort from backward point. This was a full toss outside off and Alam looked like he'd timed it well enough to sneak a boundary there. Dives to his left, full length, and keeps it to one
low full toss on the pads, waits for it and clips to long leg. Fourth single off the over
shortish and on middle and off, makes room outside leg and guides well behind point
low full toss on middle, picked away to deep midwicket to bring up a very rapid, very useful fifty partnership
fullish on middle and leg, now he's bowling to his field. Akmal digs it out to long-on
length ball outside off, Alam can only smear it as far as mid-off. Mahela takes a shy at the stumps and Thisara was shying away from the ball instead of backing up. Single off the overthrow
slower ball, dragged shot and this is slapped straight to cover. There's no one in the deep and he was looking to take advantage. Should had done better there.
yorker on middle and leg, jams down a straight bat to mid-on
excellent delivery, yorker on off stump as Akmal tries to whip it away and gets the inside edge onto pad
yorker just outside off, squeezed out to deep point
slower ball on leg stump, Alam works it to deep square leg knowing Akmal is in better hitting form
walks at him as this ends up an off-stump yorker. Akmal digs it out square and takes a single

another slower ball on the pads, Alam should have tickled that around the corner with fine leg in the circle but he doesn't time it well enough. Mahela was the man who dives to his left and fields with the injured hand
low full toss just below the hips, Akmal flicks it away to deep midwicket to bring up Pakistan's 200
low full toss on off stump and he opens the face to steer it down to deep third man
fullish and outside off, punched towards point to complete six singles off the over
good length ball as he hurries down the track and swings to deep midwicket. That's a couple
fullish and sliding into leg stump, whipped away to deep square leg. Followed the batsman who was trying to make room to carve over extra
short and wide, far too much so. Alam doesn't bother with it
full and just outside off, Alam puts his front foot down leg stump and shovels it through to deep cover. He takes a bit of time to rest up before taking strike again
low full toss outside off, he taps it towards deep point and then bends over his bat at the other end, heaving for breath. He's rather struggling out there
flicked through to deep midwicket as this is fullish on middle. Hurries to the top of his mark to get his over done
full and wide outside off, Alam slaps it as far as extra cover to retain strike.
low full toss and he has mis-hit it into the covers! Was a little late on the jump and Chaturanga de Silva has parried it over his head. That's a bad drop
it was always on the cards. Another full toss and Akmal has enlisted the use of those strong wrists and whips it one-bounce to the midwicket boundary
full and just outside off, pushed towards the covers
full and wide outside off, Alam has smeared it straight to point and set off. Thirimanne took aim and Alam had almost given up. Bad throw though allows a single
another terrific flick through to the midwicket boundary. It was another low full toss and Akmal ventured forward and whirled the bat. Right off the middle
slower short ball and almost as if he knew that was the ball Malinga would bowl, Akmal waits on the back foot and taps it fine of short third man. What a shot. What an over, 15 off it

Hundred for Alam and he reaches it with a thrilling flick over midwicket! He's the first Pakistan left-hander outside the opener's position to reach three figures! Another low full toss and he strides forward and dismisses it from his presence. Knew it straight away and took off his helmet and raised his bat
clears his front leg and slaps a fuller delivery outside off to mid-off
full on leg stump, chipped to long-on
yorker on off stump, Alam digs it out and Akmal calls him through for a single. Dangerous ploy and the bowler does well taking aim at Akmal's end. Direct hit was needed
there's Akmal's fifty, off only 35 balls and what a shot to get it from. It was a low full toss outside off, Akmal stayed beside it and carved it behind point. Found the gap with pin-point precision
races down the track and smashes the length ball over extra cover to signal the century partnership! This is becoming a glut now
skips down the track and nudges it down to long-on. "Two, two two," someone says but Alam is too tired
lovely delivery. That's the first dot ball since 41.3. The inswinging yorker just about dug out. Sri Lanka need so much more of those

wide full toss to stymie the batsman moving outside leg. Akmal reaches out and gets it off the bottom of the bat and it looked set to beat short third man, but Mahels dives to his left and sticks out that injured hand again
fullish on middle and leg, Alam turns it away to midwicket on the circle

fullish and tailing in, Akmal was setting up for an extra cover drive again as he made himself some room but hits straight to Angelo Mathews, who seems to be disgruntled about something. Possibly over no one backing up as he got ready to throw
moves outside off to slog it over the leg side and is benefited by Lakmal offering a low full toss. Gets a top edge that sails towards the long leg boundary. Guess Pakistan don't need Afridi
low full toss outside leg, Akmal whips it to deep midwicket and rushes through for a couple
yorker on middle stump. Excellent delivery that keeps Akmal to a single
low full toss outside off, how many of those have been bowled in the last 10? Alam clears his front leg and drills to long-off

slower ball outside leg, Akmal slogs to present a leading edge which is held by backward point. That's Malinga's fifth wicket. Excellent change up, he knew Akmal was looking for those leg side heaves and outsmarted him

this is full on leg stump, Alam ensures his feet don't get in the way and whips it behind square leg. Picked it up and put it away. What a shot. Remember folks, he's very tired out there. He had to stand up by his bat at the non-strkers' but he's doing the job

full and outside off, stays leg side and thumps it to long-on to end the innings. Afridi walks up to an exhausted Alam and pats him on the back for his effort. He's held the innings together and has given Pakistan a very competitive score

inn2.comm: lovely start. tossed up on middle and off, Kusal is forward with a dead bat
good length ball sliding down, nudged away to deep square leg
flighted on middle, strides forward to block
flighted on middle and leg, Lahiru comes forward and keeps it out
stays leg side and blocks to short cover. Nice flight as he refuses any room
pushed through on off stump, defended under his eyes

dear me, that was top-class! It was overpitched and it had width, yes. But Kusal just leaned forward and punched it through the covers. Nothing of a followthrough but it just screamed off the bat and he held the pose and admired
back of a length and just outside off, shuffles in line and hits to short cover
fullish on off stump and he pushes it down the ground. Hafeez at mid-on runs around and dives to his left to save three. Hint of inswing for Gul there
fullish and probing in the channel, Lahiru isn't tempted

shortish and it was angling across him. Lahiru has slapped it to point and Shehzad is down! He's clutching his left wrist. He's rolling around in agony and the physio comes out, slaps a bit of ice on it and he walks off the field. That was nasty. He was diving to his left and saved a certain boundary, but how bad is the damage?
fullish and slid across him, Kusal isn't too keen on footwork but his hands are good as he drives to cover
flighted on off stump, defends
tossed up on middle and leg, he lunges forward and sweeps to short fine leg
it's on the pads and Kusal tickles it around the corner, but Gul at leg gully dives to his right and keeps it to none
good length ball on middle and leg, defended
flighted outside off, Kusal goes after it with a slog sweep. Beats the infield by going over them but there is a man in the deep
short and pushed through, that was what he was looking for as he unleashes a short-armed jab that was going nowhere other than the midwicket boundary. Cue the Jayasuriya comparisons
137 kph, short and wide and Lahiru joins in the act. Gets underneath it and hit behind point. It was uppish but it was rather well timed again.
shortish and angled into him, nudged to midwicket
fullish and just outside off, comes forward and blocks quite solidly!

over the lone slip fielder! Goes for it and that's why he's evaded Afridi, who was leaping up and sticking his right hand over his head. Just a bit more room than is advisable. Hafeez moves into slip now and Afridi is at short cover
fullish and outside off, left alone
shortish and outside off, stands up tall to get on top of the bounce and drop into the covers
struck outside off. Goes for a sweep as this is full and on off stump. Big appeal, but umpire Llong says it struck him on the elbow and outside off. So height was a factor too
flighted on middle and off, strides forwrad to defend
pushed through on middle and it goes on with the arm, Kusal punches to mid-on
flighted on middle, comes forward and blocks
nicely tossed up on middle as Kusal comes forward and defends towards the covers
good length ball on middle and leg, pushed to long-on
good length ball and he's lured into an ill-advised swipe through midwicket. It's a favourite of his, but had that took the inside edge, I'd wager his stumps would be in disarray
good length ball outside off, opens the face and guides it into the covers. Used softer hands than normal
there it is! This time he's connected it and the swipe hurtles to the midwicket boundary. Little more room outside off which assists him in freeing his arms
back of a length and in the channel, punched to point

fullish and just outside off, Kusal has taken another page out of the Jayasuriya play book. Slammed over the top of mid-off and it pulls up at the boundary. Misbah slips there, so might be the first signs of dew
turned it around to the right of short fine leg. It was short and a little too close to the hips and Kusal simply took advantage of the pace of the bowler. Half-pull, half-flick. Full effect
good length ball just outside off, goes back and pushes back to the bowler
slows it up just outside off and Lahiru had to wait on the front foot before defending with an open face
pushed through quicker and it slides towards the leg side, tickled away to deep square leg
flighted on middle and leg, worked away to short fine
this was not short, but he rocked back and punches through the covers. How much power does he have in that bottom hand of his?!

big appeal for leg before as he charges down the track. This was speared in, but I suspect the impact was outside off again. Would have been out otherwise. Umpire Llong says no straight away and Hafeez is first disconsolate before breaking into a little smile. He's liking this battle, let me assure you
fullish and just outside off, pushed towards the covers
bit of room outside off and Lahiru waits on the back foot and steers it well behind point
risky stroke as he looks to cream this back of a length ball towards the long-on boundary. "Catch," says Misbah like I did too, but though this was a mis-hit, it clears Ajmal quite comfortably
length ball on the pads, Kusal whips it away through square leg
back of a length just outside off, punched towards point
shortish on off stump, Lahiru is on the back foot and nudges straight of midwicket
skips down the track as this is flighted on off stump, defended towards short cover
another little foray down the track and pushes towards mid-on. Ajmal races across and picks the ball himself
waits on the back foot and clips towards midwicket. Looks for the single, but is sent back
big appeal as this is pushed through on off stump. Kusal came forward to the doosra and gets an inside edge onto pad. No chance of leg before there
fullish and outside off, strides forward and blocks
lovely line and this was quicker at 92 kph. Kusal has to hurry into his defensive push. Plonks his bat in front of pad. That was designed for the leg before, but the batsman does well
back of a length and outside off, steered to deep third man
pulled away and boy, he can strike with some power! Whistles away to the boundary as this was pitched short and affords him room to free his arms. Hit in front of square!
goes fuller and angles it into him. Kusal works towards midwicket

Sharjeel has stamped on the boundary rope while taking this catch! It ends up a six! This was shortish on off stump and Kusal goes for another of his pulls and the fielder was backtracking on the boundary, without realising how close he was and pulls off a decent catch, but where was his awareness? That shall go down as a drop and a very funny one at that
slower ball, on a length and outside off. Defended
fullish and outside off, strides forward and finds long-off

he's completely duped him! Ajmal, you beauty! Kusal was racing down the track but Ajmal pulls his length back and gets this to jag away. Beats his defensive push and the keeper completes a simple stumping. Ajmal leaps up in celebration, he enjoyed that. And I bet Sharjeel did too

leg before first ball! Ajmal is doing a Malinga! The crowd is buzzing as Sanga plays outside the line of a doosra! Defends around his front pad and gets struck in line with middle. Would have gone on to hit leg and Sanga has to walk
doosra again and Mahela has not picked it at all! Goes back and plays inside the line of it as this turns away, bounces off the deck and hits his thighs outside the line of off stump
flighted on off stump and this turns into him sharply, Mahela rides it to turn towards midwicket
tossed up and this is another doosra. Lahiru lunges forward to defend and gets a thick inside edge which scurries away to the left of short fine leg. Junaid dives but can't stop it
flighted on off stump, defended

back of a length and outside off, drops it at his feet and Mahela calls him through for a quick single. That was close, especially with the bowler rushing in off his followthrough. Decides to pick the ball up instead of kicking it to the stumps
fullish and just outside off, Mahela is forward and defends off a thick inside edge
fullish and outside off, Mahela leans into a gorgeous extra cover drive and races off for a single. He was rather eager for that
digs it in outside off, Lahiru was on the back foot and pulls to the square leg boundary. Only looked to give it direction as he bisects deep square leg and long leg
good length ball which is angled in on middle. Lahiru is in front of all his stumps and blocks
good length ball, ducks in off the pitch as Lahiri defends with soft hands
goes on straight as Mahela goes back and blocks. Think he read that
flighted just outside off, Mahela is forward and blocks with soft hands. Short leg in business
nicely flighted just outside off as he lures Mahela forward. Pushed towards mid-on
waits on this to turn and tucks it off the back foot towards short leg. Can't beat him on his right
doosra, does not read it as this goes off the leading edge towards point. Lots of cases for the silly point
flighted outside off and Mahela keeps it out. Maiden over to follow one with two wickets. Ajmal, you superstar
fullish delivery outside off, Lahiru shuffles across and gets a thick inside edge onto the pad. Playing too far away from the body and that could easily have shattered his stumps. Inspects his bat
134kph, back of a length and just outside off, Lahiru blocks under his eyes
133kph, poor line and poor length to boot. Short and down leg side as Lahiru helps it away off the back foot. Pulls in between deep square and fine legs.
fullish on middle and off, pushed down to mid-off. Mahela was haring across but Lahiru screams a string of no's. Afridi takes aim and misses
fullish on leg stump, comes forward and punches straight down the ground. So well timed but it goes back to the bowler
134kph, short and on the pads again. Lahiru's been feeding off those all through his innings. Picked away to the long leg boundary
flighted on middle and leg, Mahela is on the back foot and turns it around for a single, but Alam is the man under the helmet and he stops it quite nicely
flighted outside off, lunges forward and defends with bat almost behind pad
doosra, nicely tossed up on off stump. Mahela goes forward and blocks rather tentatively
there's his class, saw this pitched a little shortish and he backs away and steers this past slip and short third man. What a sublime late cut
answers with a doosra, which Mahela reads off the pitch and blocks off the back foot

loopy offspinner to finish as Mahela strides forward to defend. Gee, this is such a lovely contest, made all the more interesting with Mahela's form and Ajmal's consistent threat and a cup on the line
flatter on leg stump, Lahiru stays back and clips towards long leg
flighted on off stump, Mahela is forward with a dead bat
short and wide, Mahela unleashes a solid cut shot but cannot beat point. Mohammad Hafeez is the man diving away to his right

no slip and a regulation edge squirts away to the third man boundary! This one drifts in and turns away after pitching, Mahela was fishing for it with a drive and survives a close call. Misbah would rue his defensiveness there. Afridi already does as he throws his hands up in the air
shorter and quicker on off stump, Mahela's a lot more comfy there as he late cuts to backward point
googly from Afridi but Mahela's picked it and worked towards short fine leg
pushed through on middle and off, goes back and clips towards square leg
flighted on middle, Mahela covers his stumps and blocks
pushes this good length ball on off stump towards mid-on. No chance of a single there as Hafeez too follows the ball
good length ball on off stump, worked to short midwicket
tossed up on off stump, Mahela moves forward and across to nudge behind square on the leg side
tossed up and this goes on with the arm, Lahiru is forward and blocks with hard hands. That will be drinks
flighted but this slides down leg, Mahela eases it to long leg for an easy escape to the non-strikers'
flighted and goes on with the arm outside off, Lahiru comes forward and blocks in front of point

Akmal is appealing without any restraint. The bowler does not join in. None of the fielders do. This was pushed through fuller and turns outside off. Mahela was coming forward to defend but is beaten by the turn. There seems to be a bit of noise as the ball passes the bat, but umpire Oxenford says no. I dont think there was a edge either
too short and boy has he climbed into this. Rocks back and whacks it over the midwicket boundary with the elegance that only Mahela can summon
single worked into the leg side, good cricket after the six
flightede on the pads, nudges into the leg side
comes down the track and swings it away to deep midwicket. He charged him and struck it with the turn. That's Sri Lanka's hundred and it comes off the top draw
flighted on off stump, draws Mahela forward to defend
good length ball just outside off, Mahela pushes an open face at it and is beaten outside off.
pushed towards mid-on but short midwicket intervenes. lenght ball on middle
flighted on middle and leg as he turns it away towards square leg. Bit of confusion there, but despite the direct hit Thirimanne makes it
tossed up outside off and he presents an open face and the square drive earns a single to deep third man
flighted outside off and Lahiru slices this to deep third man again.
flighted on middle and off, defended off the front foot
swift and short as Mahela goes back and pulls towards deep square leg
was that a drop? Yes, big outside edge as he doesn't pick the googly and Akmal grasses it. Draws him to poke away from his body. The keeper rose a little too early
flighted outside off, pushed through to the sweeper off the front foot and an open face

skips down the track and gets struck on the front pad with a googly. Big appeal from Afridi but umpire Oxenford is unmoved again. Misbah walks across and asks a polite "why". Too far down the track, I suspect but that was pretty adjacent
flightede on middle and leg, slides down
this time he targets outside off and Lahiru drives to long-off for a single. Fifty partnership between these two
length ball outside off, worked away towards deep midwicket
flighted on middle and off, he comes forward and blocks into the covers
bit of bounce on middle and leg as he works it towards short fine leg
flighted on middle and leg, Lahiru is forward and gets a thick inside edge towards square leg

that was terrible work from Gul on the square leg boundary. Lets the ball through his legs and into the boundary. It was a solid sweep from Lahiru and probably deserved a boundary, but not when a man is posted for that shot. A drop catch, some frustration over tight decisions and this misfield. Are Pakistan slipping?
flighted on off stump, eased down the ground
tossed up outside off, he strides forward and pushes towards long-on

that's a Mahela special. He is so good with that late cut. Touch short from Afridi and he makes stays beside it and waits for the ball to almost pass him before finding the gap between backard point and short third man
flighted outside off, strides forward the defend
loops up the googly, I suspect, but Mahela was on the front foot and reaches the pitch to flay it through the covers
good length ball on and around off stump, Lahiru cuts towards the sweeper
gets a bit of shape away outside off and Lahiru has guided this to the third man boundary. Opens the face and gets a handy edge to the boundary

back of a length on middle, clipped through the vancant midwicket region to reach an important fifty. His seventh on ODIs and gets a pat on the head from Mahela. Lots more work to do, but he punches his fists because he has survived a very tricky period over the past hour or so
fullish on the pads, Mahela clips it efficiently down to deep square leg who fumbles. Sharjeel again
short and wide, slapped to point
good length ball, just outside off. Mahela moves back and across and runs it down to third man. He's milking it as only he can. 131 off 163 balls needed now
slower short ball, on leg stump. Lahiru has spotted it and works it off his hips
back of a length and just outside off, Lahiru shuffles across and carves it to deep third man
shortish and angled in on off stump as he switches around the wicket. Mahela dabs with soft hands into the leg side
135kph, goes for that dab to third man but gets a bottom edge to this shortish ball outside off. Slips runs up to mop up
fullish and angled in on off stump, Mahela lets it come to him and uses such soft hands to nudge towards midwicket. There is a man stopping the single, but he's doing a bad job

that tails in, but Lahiru uses it to whip towards deep square leg. Talha pulls out the big boot and Sharjeel was going to throw it back to the keeper, but can't pick up the ball. Gives away a third. Out in the first over, stepped on the boundary after taking a catch and now fumbling on the outfield. Not a happy return to the XI for Sharjeel
fullish and outside off, he comes forward and pushes towards short cover. Beats him on the dive and was looking for a single, but mid-off is too quick
good length ball on middle and leg, worked straight of midwicket for a single.
138kph, a lazy push away from the body but the thick edge lands safely. Single to third man. Nice line from Talha as he teases him outside off
fullish and it was angled away from him, Lahiru was forward and uses the open face to find the gap between point and cover
fullish on off stump, Mahela shuffles across and flicks through midwicket and already they are up with the required rate per over, without any risk
length ball on the pads and the deep square leg fielder dives too soon! It's Hafeez this time. What timing. It was not the best ball but this was picked off his pads with complete authority
length and on the pads again, eased towards deep midwicket
fullish and angled into leg stump, worked to the left of midwicket. There's only one man saving the single on that side

fullish and just outside off, Mahela uses soft hands to defend towards mid-on and calls Lahiru through. It was his call and how well has he judged this. It was Gul there, not one of Pakistan's best fielders
fullish on off stump, but this keeps rather low! Defends off the front foot and gets it right off the bottom of the bat. Inspects it after
length ball cramping him on middle and leg, defended towards short midwicket. Good move with Junaid bowling this angle

fullish and outside off, leans into a drive and presents the full face of the bat. Quick single to the man at mid-off, who had to move to his right. Doesn't pick the ball up. Could have been a tight single, but Gul messes up again. Shoulders falling here for Pakistan
fullish and just outside off, defends off the front foot
flighted on off stump, Lahiru is forward and blocks. Gets a thick inside edge which makes me think he started with a doosra
flighted on off stump, goes forward and blocks in front of point. Lahiru was going for the single but there was a loud scream of no from Mahela
goes back and clips through square leg. Seven in the circle for Ajmal
lovely flight on off stump, Mahela strides forward and turns to midwicket
quick turn off a good length as Mahela rides it towards deep fine leg to bring up the 150
doosra and he's picked it! Goes back and covers his stumps to block down the pitch
defended into the leg side off a good length delivery

too short and too wide outside off, Lahiru stands up tall and slaps it behind point. Uses the pace of the bowler as he got on top of the bounce. Alam at point asks third man to mop up but this was timed too well
back of a length and just outside off, pushed into the covers
fullish and just outside off, Mahela is forward and blocks with an open face
shortish and outside off, Mahela ducks and allows it through
full and angled in on off stump, flicked to long leg where Ajmal bounds in and keeps it to one
flighted on off stump, eases forward and blocks with those lovely, soft hands
lovely loop on this outside off, Mahela is not lured in as he presents a dead bat
good length ball just outside off, goes back and blocks
ripping turn from outside off, Mahela was looking to flick it away and is beaten. But since it goes down leg, it's called a wide. So harsh
flighted on middle and off, Mahela comes forward to block
tosses the doosra up on off stump, Mahela has picked it and blocks into the off side. They've shut up shop against Ajmal.
down leg again as this is a length ball pitches on leg and turns further. Left alone
flighted on off stump, defended calmly through point
starts off with room outside off, dabbed to deep third man
back of a length and outside off, pushed into the covers as he stands up tall to get on top of the bounce
shortish on off stump, Lahiru is back and punches towards point
good length ball just outside off, Mahela blocks with an open face
dab to third man on the boundary as this is shortish with a bit of room. That's bread and butter for Mahela
bouncer on middle stump, that got some height and despite putting the batsman in a rather awkward position, this ends up a single to deep square leg. Merit to Lahiru as he goes back and hooks well
pushed full and outside off, Lahiru blocks a little away from his body
turns in off a fuller length on middle. Lahiru works towards square leg

bit of room outside off and Lahiru taps it fine. Mahela races across, it was his call, but Lahiru stayed put watching the ball nervously. Gul misfields and allows a couple. There was a definite chance at the bowler's end had he picked it up
good length ball just outside off, punched to deep cover
loopy delivery outside off lures Mahela into an expansive drive through the off side. Beats the outside edge and the keeper as well
flighted on middle and turning towards off, Lahiru keeps his front leg outside the line and drives to mid-on
shortish and just outside off, dabs to deep third man with a lot of wristwork. Somehow he pulls it off without any fuss. Controlled this chase so well, has Mahela
full and slides this across the left-hander who can't help himself. Goes for a terrible drive on the up and is beaten comprehensively. Akmal doesn't do so well behind the wicket either
good length ball which across across him, uses the angle and runs it down to the third man boundary. Played a lot more closer to his body and this was very much intentional. Clever stroke

back of a good length on off stump, punches it down the pitch and the bowler takes aim at the batsman's stumps. There's a bit of a verbal altercation here between Gul and Thirimanne. Mahela comes in and breaks it up. It was Thirimanne who went forward to talk to the bowler after he was being stared down

good length ball on off stump, defended into the leg side and Gul goes to field it himself. Jogs forward to the batsman to stare him down face-to-face. Has an arm around the umpire who comes up to steady things
bouncer outside off, Lahiru is on the back foot and hooks to deep square leg. Time for drinks
flighted on middle and gets a bit of turn, but nothing to worry the batsman who lunges forward to defend
tossed up on off stump, pushed to long-on
flighted just outside off, he waits on the front foot and adjusts with his hands as he opens the face towards point
grip and turn on this good length ball. Mahela was making room and was set to slap it through point, but then checks his shot
good length ball on middle, goes back and guides to deep cover.
crashed through the covers! Makes total use of the flight Afridi offers as he takes a long stride forward and drills it. It was uppish but he'd found the gap

two great shots in two balls. Gul offeres width outside off and Mahela pounces. Gets on the back foot and cuts behind point. That's his fifty, his first in 13 innings and the SL dressing room is up on their feet

skier at deepmidwicket and Hafeez's dive is not enough. Dropped and it dribbles to the boundary. It was a length ball on middle but Mahela goes for it. Walks forward and heaves it but gets more of a top-edge. Hafeez was running to his left but he was never comfortable under it
short ball, bounces too far over his head
slower ball and the offcutter grips on the pitch and turns into him. Defends with only the top hand on the bat
fullish and outside off, he's driven it to the left of mid-off. Calls through for a well-judged single
fullish and outside off, strides forward to block
fullish on off stump, defended back to the bowler who feigns a throw. The Thirimanne-Gul impasse continues
tossed up outside off, Mahela laps it fine for a couple. Went right across to ensure he wasn't in front of off stump.
tossed up and this dips on off stump, Mahela is forward and blocks square on the leg side
defended to midwicket as this is looped up on middle and off
dabbed away behind point as this is a length ball outside off
good length ball just outside off, Lahiru stays back and cuts to point
flighted on middle, Lahiru blocks off the front foot
141kph, shortish and just outside off. Absorbs all the pace as he dabs towards point with soft hands and rushes through for a single
135kph, bouncer on middle, Lahiru swivels on the back foot and keeps the hook down
132kph, yorker just outside off, dug out behind point
slower length ball, slides down the leg side. Akmal cannot collect it cleanly. And to make matters worse, Talha has overstepped. Free hit time. Giant no-ball, by the way

135kph, knows the leg side is useless so he makes room outside off and thumps this through extra cover. It was very full and outside leg stump too, but Mahela has set himself up wonderfully well to find the boundary

slice of luck for Mahela as he is beaten by pace. Top-edge goes over the keeper's head for a one-bounce four. Short ball from Talha allows the batsman to go for a pull. On another day that might have gone straight up
good length ball just outside off, stays back and blocks with soft hands
pushed through and it goes on with the arm, picked it and whips it off his pads to deep square leg
flighted on off stump, Mahela isn't tempted as he blocks with a straight bat
took that on the full as he sweeps to the right of square leg. Magnificent shot against the spinner. Good stride forward and he made sure he was outside off before unfurling a full swing of the arms
clipped to long leg as this is pushed through on a good length on leg stump
too early into the shot and he gets a bottom edge. This was tossed up on middle and he goes for a sweep. Lucky that the ball just dribbled down to the bowler
flighted on middle and off, defended off the front foot
shortish on off stump, stays back and blocks down the pitch

straight up in the air and Sharjeel just about takes it at cover. That's the end of Mahela. Fullish delivery on off stump and he goes for a swipe across the line. Not quite the shot you expect  from a player so experienced with a chase to shepherd. The fielder gingerly settled under it, or so he thought, and had to dive forward to take it cleanly. Tough catches that under the night sky
128kph, bouncer on leg stump, Lahiru is not shy of hooking and he keeps this down as well. Long leg mops up
fullier and just outside off, Priyanjan leaves it alone
short and wide, terrible ball even to a new batsman. Especially to a new batsman who tucks into it. Cut away and didn't bother keeping it down. Carved away
shortish and wide again, Priyanjan lets this through to the keeper. Fuller than the last which was it's saving grace
lovely loop on this as Lahiru strides forward and blocks with an open face
good length ball on middle and leg, think this was the straighter one. Defended
fullish and angled into him, Lahiru keeps it out
flighted just outside off, Priyanjan is forward and blocks into the covers
drives into the covers with a whip of the wrists. Nice flight again
there it is, that was what Priyanjan was afraid of. The doosra on a good length and it rips right across him. Bounce, turn and beaten

good length ball on off stump, gets a thick inside edge onto pad. Wanders away behind point and they scurry through for a quick single. Shehzad comes up and falls awkwardly on his shoulder. is that the injured one? He seems to be flexing it
just a touch too short again and Priyanjan slaps it to the left of point. Shehzad dives and keeps it to none. Gets some pats from his team-mates. Still working that shoulder
good length ball on off stump, defended after moving back and across
works away to deep square leg as this is on a good length on off stump.
guides it to the third man boundary. It's a length ball pushed across him and Thirimanne waits for it and presents an angled blade. Gorgeous stroke. One shot away from a ton, Thirimanne

fullish and on the pads and he's been hit on his knee! Clutches it as he hobbles around in the crease. This has evaded his pads and struck right on the bone as he was looking to flick it away. The physio's out there tending to him, but it looks alright
tossed up on off stump, he comes forward and keeps it out
skips down the track and worked to short midwicket. Flighted and just outside off again
skips down the track and heaves this towards the midwicket boundary. Sharjeel lumbers around and saves the boundary. Only just. Flight works against Hafeez there
so he pushes it through flat and quick on middle. Priyanjan goes back and clips it uppishly through midwicket
tossed up on leg stump as he goes around the wicket. Pushed down to long-off
tossed up on off stump, comes down the track to get to the pitch and drives to long-on
good length ball, eased behind point. Shehzad is excellent again, runs across and rives to his left and keeps it to none. Clutches his shoulder again
full with room outside off, Priyanjan slaps it down to the long-on boundary. Afridi was the man at mid-on and tries to stop it with his foot. His injury is obviously taking its toll
good length ball just outside off, Priyanjan pushes outside off and is beaten

nicks off as he looks to guide it down to third man. That's Junaid first wicket of the tournament. Good length ball just a shade outside off. Terrible shot considering there was slip in place as well. Regulation edge and a diving take to his right ends his stay at the middle.
good length ball targeting off stump, Mathews defends with one hand off the bat
fullish on middle and off, defended cautiously
flighted on off stump, defended with an open face as Thirimanne ticks over to 97
pushed through quick and flat on middle, punched to long-on. Bit of a collision between the non-striker and the bowler as the set off for the run
tossed up on leg stump, nudged towards square leg for a single
goes back and punches towards long-on. Again flatter on off stump
tossed up on off stump, Lahiru comes forward with an open face to find another single through point
worked away to long leg as this is a length ball on middle and leg
races down the track and slashes this away over the covers. Mighty stroke. it was a length ball and he's laced it over the top with pure authority
that has missed the off stump by a whisker! Again Mathews is down the track and this time he's slogging across the line and is beaten soundly.
shortish and outside off, Mathews whips it through the vacant midwicket region to return strike to Lahiru on 99

inswinging yorker but he's dug it out to square leg and punches the air as he runs through for the single that gives him a second ton in the tournament. Punches the air with the helmet to boot and also punches gloves with his captain. A whole lot of punching going on out there.
good length ball on middle and off, but he works the angle because the bowler continues around the wicket. Whipped to deep square leg
fullish and darts in, but Lahiru has been out there long enough to clip it away to deep square leg

doosra goes through his defences! In his final over he produces a beauty! Lahiru was on the front foot looking to defend, but offers a big gap between bat and pad. Beats the poking bat, strikes the pad on the knee roll and crashes into the stumps
this one slides down the leg side. Doosra again from Ajmal but he's started this too straight
flighted juts outside off and he lunges forward and blocks away from the body
flighted on off stump, strides forward to defend
loops it up nice and slow. Defended by de Silva and Ajmal asks why won't you hit me over the top, there was enough flight on that. Misbah wears a wry smile
flighted outside off and this time he essays a more aggressive drive to cover
flighted just outside off and a forward defence to end Ajmal's spell. The only bowler who threatened the batsmen all through the innings. I could almost hear Mathews and De Silva heaving giant sighs
fullish and outside off, Mathews pushes down to mid-on
good length ball on off stump, dabs in front of mid-on. Confusion between the pair, but in the end they make the single
good length ball on off stump, kept out
full and just outside off, drilled down the ground but finds the fielder
full and slides down the pads. De Silva helps it on its way to the long leg boundary with a neat little flick. There was reverse on offer for Junaid but he doesn't control it too well.
fullish and outside off, whips through to deep midwicket
short ball just outside off and Mathews has pulled it off one leg and finds the deep square leg boundary. Sharjeel has given up the chase. Punches his fists as he realises his team are almost there

that's it, Mathews hits the winning runs and holds his hands aloft! Giant smile on his face, big whoops as he swings his bat around to celebrate victory. Hugs his partner and goes back over to shake hands with the opposition. It was a shortish ball on off stump, he was on the back foot and nudged it with soft hands towards long leg who was right on the boundary. Knew it was two since he hit the ball and Sri Lanka have completed a thoroughly clean performance
